body_html: @SsnL tensor.new_ones(...) is less verbose than torch.ones_like(..., **tensor.options()), but is not very intuitive/readable to new users IMO either. Another variant: torch.ones(..., type_as = tensor) or torch.ones(..., as = tensor)?
body_text: @SsnL tensor.new_ones(...) is less verbose than torch.ones_like(..., **tensor.options()), but is not very intuitive/readable to new users IMO either. Another variant: torch.ones(..., type_as = tensor) or torch.ones(..., as = tensor)?
body: @SsnL `tensor.new_ones(...)` is less verbose than `torch.ones_like(..., **tensor.options())`, but is not very intuitive/readable to new users IMO either. Another variant: `torch.ones(..., type_as = tensor)` or `torch.ones(..., as = tensor)`?
